item.title: Introducing AutoRound
item.description:
As large language models (LLMs) and vision-language models (VLMs) continue to grow in size and complexity, deploying them efficiently becomes increasingly challenging. Quantization offers a solution by reducing model size and inference latency. Intel's AutoRound emerges as a cutting-edge quantization tool that balances accuracy, efficiency, and compatibility.

AutoRound is a weight-only post-training quantization (PTQ) method developed by Intel. It uses signed gradient descent to jointly optimize weight rounding and clipping ranges, enabling accurate low-bit quantization (e.g., INT2 - INT8) with minimal accuracy loss in most scenarios. For example, at INT2, it outperforms popular baselines by up to 2.1x higher in relative accuracy.

item.title: Intel GPU Tools - Linux
item.description:
Overview

This article talks about Intel GPU tools for Linux to monitor usage of integrated Intel GPUs

When to use

The scenarios in which I've used this tool is to confirm that my browser is leveraging hardware acceleration. By default, Firefox doesn't enable hardware acceleration on Linux. As a result, everything runs on the CPU causing unnecessary load and faster battery drain. To alleviate that, you can enable hardware acceleration and make sure that the GPU is being used by running tools like intel_gpu_top.

Install

To install the tools, run the following command

sudo pacman -S intel-gpu-tools

Run intel_gpu_top

To view GPU activity, run the following command:

sudo intel_gpu_top

This will display process graphs of GPU usage.
